page.title: 09TOURISM IN LLANSTEFFAN
page.content: The wide smooth sandy beach and the beauty of our countryside attract summer visitors who like peaceful holidays. Years ago miners from the South Wales valleys came in their hundreds by train to Ferryside and by ferry across the Tywi. Now tourists come by car. There are two small static caravan sites and some houses are "second homes" owned by people mostly from England. A number of residents offer bed-and-breakfast accomodation. Most visitors come for the day. Camping vans are not allowed to park overnight but sometimes a tent appears on the dunes.
